amendment.description: To create a point of order against legislation that would undermine the historic coverage gains the United States has made in children's health, which have resulted in the lowest uninsured rate for children in the Nation's history.

action.text: Amendment SA 86 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive section 305(b)(2) of the CBA with respect to amendment SA 86 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 49. Record Vote Number: 25.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 305(b)(2) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 86.
Amendment SA 86 proposed by Senator Sanders for Senator Brown.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive section 305(b)(2) of the CBA with respect to amendment SA 86 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 49. Record Vote Number: 25.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 86 proposed by Senator Sanders for Senator Brown.
